content:
12. Where did the Lord appear to Solomon in a dream 
A. Horeb B. Gibeon C.  Gath D. Jericho 
 
13. The division of David’s kingdom was a direct consequence 
of 
A. Absalom’s revolt 
B. Jeroboam’s revolt 
C. Solomon’s forced labour 
D. Rehoboam’s unwise decision 
 
14. Naaman’s leprosy was transferred to Gehazi as a result 
of 
A. the testimony of the maid of Israel 
B. Gehazi’s disobedience to God 
C. the gifts he received from Naaman 
D. the bathe Gehazi took in the river Jordan. 
 
15. The prayer of Elijah is the name of God of Abraham, 
Isaac and Jacob brought down fire from heaven which 
A. killed all the prophets of Baal 
B. destroyed the demonic spirits of Jezebel 
C. caused rain to fall immediately 
D. consumed the burnt offering. 
 
16. The reforms of King Josiah were made possible by the 
A. discovery of book of law 
B. encouragement he received from Hezekiah 
C. sacrifices he made to God 
D. destruction of the chariot Ahaz 
 
17. As Nehemiah embarked on reconstruction of Jerusalem, 
he faced threats and opposition from 
A. Lacrit Malchijah 
B. Artaxerxes and Darius 
C. Shadrack and Abednego 
D. Sanballat and Tobiah 
 
18. Amos told the Israelites that they have turned justice 
into 
A. injustice B. poison C. wormwood D. anguish. 
 
19. Hosea compared Judah’s love for the Lord to the 
morning cloud because it 
A. goes away early like the dew 
B. is a sincere love 
C. goes up to God like a smoke 
D. is a delicate love 
 
20. The attribute of God which Isaiah emphasize most is 
His 
A. goodness B. holiness C. love D. kindness 
 
21. ... even though you make prayers, I will not listen ... 
Why will God the Holy one of Israel not listen? 
A. because they sacrifice with incense to Him 
B. because God detests their burnt offerings of 
rams 
C. becuase their hands are full of blood 
D. because their new moon gift are a burden to 
Him. 
 
22. How did God convince Jeremiah of his divine call? 
A. He anointed him with oil 
B. He spoke to him directly from heaven 
C. He sent a prophet to inform him 
D. He touched his mouth. 
 
23. The vision of the dry bones of Ezekiel portrays 
A. famine B. hope C. punishment D. judgement. 
 
24. What was Peter’s reaction when he saw the great shoal 
of fish he and his partners caught? 
A. He felt very pleased 
B. He was embarrassed 
C. He confessed being a sinner 
D. He was greatly confused. 
 
25. In the feeding of the five thousand, according to 
Matthew, the first thing that Jesus did was to 
A. order the loaves and fish to be brought to Him 
B. break the loaves and fish brought to Him 
C. look up to heaven and pray to God 
D. give thanks to God and have the fish and 
loaves shared. 
 
26. Acording to John, the six stone jar of water which Jesus 
turned into wine were kept there for the 
A. collection of drinking water 
B. Miracle 
C. Jewish rites of purification 
D. wedding 
 
27. When the man with an unclean spirit in the region of t 
he Gerasenes saw Jesus, he 
A. acknowledge Him as the son of the most High 
God. 
B. pleaded to be cast into the Abyss 
C. requested to follow Him as a disciple 
D. pleaded that a miracle be performed to cleanse 
him. 
 
28. “To you it has given to know the secrets of the kingdom 
of heaven, but to them it has not been given ...” This 
statement was made after Jesus had told the parable of 
the 
A. mustard seed B. sower 
C. wheat and tares   D. leaven 
 
29. The parable of the lost sheep portrays the sheperd as 
being 
A. foolish B. patient C. careless D. loving. 
 
30. “... Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, ...” 
This statement shows that Jesus 
A. does not want Christians to be rich 
B. forbids worldly possessions by believers 
C. wants Christians to seek first kingdom of God 
D. regards poverty as a condition for the kingdom 
of God. 
 
31. Jesus commissioned the twelve disciples charging them 
to 
A. go to all the world and preach 
B. go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel 
C. receive hospitality and wages for their labour 
D. performed healing miracles among the 
Samaritans. 
 
32. According to Mark, after Jesus had triumphantly 
entered Jerusalem, He 
A. went first into the temple 
B. went to Bethany with the twelve
